sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"地点，位置，场所"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: place, position, spot, situation, site, location, locality, setting, scene
means: place ： 含义广泛，最普通用词，既可指很小的地点，又可指很大很远的地方或场所。
position ： 多指物体相对于其他物体所处的位置或状态。
spot ： 指相对较小的特定地点或事物所在地。
situation ： 指物体在其周围环境中所处的位置或状态，侧重地点或场所的环境特征。
site ： 指或大或小的地方，既可指供专门用途或特定活动的地点，又可指某一事件的地址。
location ： 指某物设置的方向或地点。
locality ： 指某物所处的客观位置和周围地区。
setting ： 一般特指戏剧或小说所写的环境或场所。
scene ： 常指真实事件或虚构故事发生的地点。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"景色，风景"之意。
means: scene ： 指具体的、局部的或一时的景色，可以是自然形成的，也可人工造成的。
view ： 普通和词，多指从远处或高处所见的景色。
sight ： 侧重指旅游观光的风光，包括城市景色或自然风光景色。也指人造景物或奇特的景色。
scenery ： 指一个国家或某一地区的整体自然风景。
landscape ： 多指在内陆的自然风光。

sentence.Network_en: The area has been the scene of fierce fighting for three months.
sentence.Network_cn: 这一地区3个月以来不断发生激战。

sentence.Network_en: The General does not like non-combatant personnel near a scene of action.
sentence.Network_cn: 将军不喜欢非战斗部队人员靠近战场。

sentence.Network_en: Harris disappeared from the scene as suddenly as he had appeared.
sentence.Network_cn: 哈里斯突然出现，又突然消失了。

phrase.cizu_name: come (或 appear 或 arrive) on the scene

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal). way of saying come on the scene above
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)。 同 come on the scene

jx.jx_en_mean: US way of sayingcome on the scene above
jx.jx_cn_mean: (美)。 同 come on the scene

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)not something one enjoys or is interested in

lj.lj_ly: as for that job you mention, not my scene.

jx.jx_en_mean: describe a place or situation in which something is about to happen
jx.jx_cn_mean: 作事前的现场（或情况）描述

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (denoting a subdivision of a play, or (a piece of) stage scenery): from Latin scena, from Greek skēnē 'tent, stage'

entry.tran: (戏剧、书的)场面，片段;(电影)镜头
entry.def: A scene in a play, film, or book is part of it in which a series of events happen in the same place.

example.ex: I found the scene in which Percy proposed to Olive tremendously poignant.
example.tran: 我觉得珀西向奥利芙求婚的一幕太让人心酸了。

example.ex: ...the opening scene of 'A Christmas Carol'.
example.tran: 《圣诞颂歌》的开篇场景

entry.tran: (给人以某种印象的)景象，场景，场面
entry.def: You refer to a place as a scene when you are describing its appearance and indicating what impression it makes on you.

example.ex: It's a scene of complete devastation...
example.tran: 那是一副满目疮痍的景象。

example.ex: Thick black smoke billowed over the scene...
example.tran: 在这一场景中浓浓的黑烟滚滚升起。

entry.tran: (通过画面显示的或看到的)事件，场面，情景
entry.def: You can describe an event that you see, or that is broadcast or shown in a picture, as a scene of a particular kind.

example.ex: There were emotional scenes as the refugees enjoyed their first breath of freedom...
example.tran: 当难民们呼吸到第一口自由的空气时，有许多感人至深的场面。

example.ex: Television broadcasters were warned to exercise caution over depicting scenes of violence...
example.tran: 电视台受到警告，要求对暴力场面的描绘采取谨慎态度。

entry.def: The scene of an event is the place where it happened.

example.ex: The area has been the scene of fierce fighting for three months...
example.tran: 这一地区 3 个月以来不断发生激战。

example.ex: ...traces left at the scene of a crime...
example.tran: 犯罪现场留下的痕迹

entry.def: You can refer to an area of activity as a particular type of scene .

example.ex: Sandman is a cult figure on the local music scene.
example.tran: 桑德曼是当地音乐界的偶像人物。

example.ex: ...when he first burst onto the national political scene at age 28.
example.tran: 当他在 28 岁刚刚闯入国家政坛时

entry.def: Paintings and drawings of places are sometimes called scenes .

example.ex: ...James Lynch's country scenes.
example.tran: 詹姆斯·林奇的乡村风景画

entry.def: If you make a scene, you embarrass people by publicly showing your anger about something.

example.ex: I'm sorry I made such a scene.
example.tran: 对不起，我失态了。

entry.tran: 在幕后;秘密地;不公开地
entry.def: If something is done behind the scenes, it is done secretly rather than publicly.

example.ex: But behind the scenes Mr Cain will be working quietly to try to get a deal done.
example.tran: 但是，凯恩先生将背地里偷偷行动以争取达成交易。

example.ex: ...behind-the-scenes discussions.
example.tran: 秘密讨论

entry.tran: (电影、戏剧、广播电视节目的制作)在幕后,在后台
entry.def: If you refer to what happens behind the scenes, you are referring to what happens during the making of a film, play, or radio or television programme.

example.ex: It's an exciting opportunity to learn what goes on behind the scenes.
example.tran: 可以有机会了解幕后的工作，令人非常兴奋。

entry.def: If you have a change of scene, you go somewhere different after being in a particular place for a long time.

example.ex: What you need is a change of scene. Why not go on a cruise?
example.tran: 你需要换换环境。为什么不乘船去旅行呢？

entry.tran: 介绍背景;事先介绍情况
entry.def: If you set the scene for someone, you tell them what they need to know in order to understand what is going to happen or be said next.

example.ex: But first to set the scene: I was having a drink with my ex-boyfriend.
example.tran: 不过首先介绍一下背景：我当时正在和前男友喝饮料。

entry.tran: 为…铺平道路;为…做好准备
entry.def: Something that sets the scene for a particular event creates the conditions in which the event is likely to happen.

example.ex: Gillespie's goal set the scene for an exciting second half.
example.tran: 吉莱斯皮的进球为下半场的精彩比赛铺平了道路。

entry.tran: 登场/离场;到场/消失;介入/摆脱
entry.def: When a person or thing appears on the scene, they come into being or become involved in something. When they disappear from the scene, they are no longer there or are no longer involved.

example.ex: He could react rather jealously when and if another child comes on the scene...
example.tran: 如果别的孩子也加入其中，他可能会表现得相当嫉妒。

example.ex: Harris disappeared from the scene as suddenly as he had appeared.
example.tran: 哈里斯突然出现，又突然消失了。

entry.def: If you say that an activity or place is not your scene, you mean that you do not like it or enjoy it.

example.ex: Lying on the beach all week isn't my scene.
example.tran: 我不喜欢整个星期都躺在沙滩上。

means.word_mean: 1. the place where some action occurs;

sentences.sentence: "the police returned to the scene of the crime"

means.word_mean: 3. the visual percept of a region;

sentences.sentence: "the most desirable feature of the park are the beautiful views"

means.word_mean: 4. a consecutive series of pictures that constitutes a unit of action in a film
5. a situation treated as an observable object;

sentences.sentence: "the religious scene in England has changed in the last century"

means.word_mean: 6. a subdivision of an act of a play;
8. graphic art consisting of the graphic or photographic representation of a visual percept;

sentences.sentence: "figure 2 shows photographic and schematic views of the equipment"

means.word_mean: 9. the context and environment in which something is set;

sentences.sentence: "the perfect setting for a ghost story"

means.word_mean: 10. the painted structures of a stage set that are intended to suggest a particular locale;

sentences.sentence: "they worked all night painting the scenery"

auth_sentence.content: I am not to attracted to the homosexual scene.
auth_sentence.res_content: I am not to attracted to the homosexual scene.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I am not to attracted to the homosexual scene.

auth_sentence.content: The cellular death recruits immune cells to the scene.
auth_sentence.res_content: The cellular death recruits immune cells to the scene.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The cellular death recruits immune cells to the scene.

auth_sentence.content: It may look like a perfect winter holiday scene.
auth_sentence.res_content: It may look like a perfect winter holiday scene.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It may look like a perfect winter holiday scene.

Sentence.sentence: But in recent years the capital's culinary (烹饪的) scene has developed to the point that it is now confident of its ability to please the tastes of any international visitor.
The scene of the crash and extent of the damage.
A Nation That's Losing Its Toolbox The scene inside the Home Depot on Weyman Avenue here would give the old-time American craftsman pause
How did the author feel looking at the scene inside the Home Depot
The evidence found at the crime scene.

means.word_mean: (戏剧的)一场, (电影、电视的)一个镜头, (小说的)一节

sentences.en: They have added a new scene at the beginning.
sentences.cn: 在开头他们又增加了一场戏。

sentences.en: He has designed all the scenes and costumes.
sentences.cn: 他设计了全部布景和服装。

sentences.en: The murder suspect couldn't explain away his fingerprints at the scene.
sentences.cn: 这个杀人嫌疑犯解释不清为什么在杀人现场会留有他的指纹。

sentences.en: We climbed higher so that we might see the scenes better.
sentences.cn: 我们又往高处爬以便能更好地观看这景色。

sentences.en: She doesn't like to make a scene before strangers.
sentences.cn: 当着生人的面, 她不愿大吵大闹。

jushi.english: The boats in the harbour make a beautiful scene.
jushi.chinese: 港内的船只构成美丽的景色。

jushi.english: The curtain is lowered at the end of each scene.
As he entered the room, he was confronted by a scene of disorder.
jushi.chinese: 他进入房间时,眼前是一片乱糟糟的景象。
